page.title: 17Cockerham Buildings of Note
page.content: Clifton Hill-19th C.mansion with Catholic Chapel,house made into three. Richmond Grove House-Georgian mansion. Crookhey-Hall-19th C.mansion-now a special school. Village school & house 19th C.with 20th C. additions. Village Hall-20th C.building. Main Street-18th C.cottages with Manor Inn-public house,formerly 16th C.barn Old Rectory-former 19th C.Vicarage, now old people's home.Rectory Gardens, 20 20th C.houses including Vicarage. Ware Cottage-16th C.crook truss frame-ruinous.Jogger Hill-16th C.crook truss frame-unoccupied. Cockerham Hall-farmhouse,probably early timber framed hall house, remodelled 19th C. Marsh Close-10 20th C.council houses. Marsh Lane-10 stone cottages,19th C. Shepherds Farm-18th C.farmhouse,listed
